freealg 1.2-2
  • Get started
  • Reference
  • Changelog

The adjoint map

adjoint.Rd

The adjoint \(\mathrm{ad}_X\) of \(X\) is a map from a Lie group \(G\) to the endomorphism group of \(G\) defined by

$$\mathrm{ad}_X(Y)=\left[X,Y\right]$$

ad(x)

Arguments

x

Object nominally of class freealg but other classes accepted where they make sense

Author

Robin K. S. Hankin

Note

Vignette adjoint gives more description

Examples


x <- rfalg()
y <- rfalg()

f <- ad(x)
f(y)
#> free algebra element algebraically equal to
#> - 7aaababba - 14aaabaccc - 35aaabb - 42aaabbb - 21aaabcaaa - 49aaabcbbb -
#> 28aaabccb - aabba - 2aaccc - 5ab - 6abb + abbaa + 7abbaaaab + 10abbab +
#> 6abbabcac + 4abbabccc - 3acaaa - 7acbbb - 4accb + 2accca + 14acccaaab + 20acccb
#> + 12acccbcac + 8acccbccc + 5ba + 35baaab - 10babba - 20baccc + 6bba + 42bbaaab
#> + 36bbbcac + 24bbbccc + 30bbcac + 20bbccc - 30bcaaa - 6bcacabba - 12bcacaccc -
#> 30bcacb - 36bcacbb - 18bcaccaaa - 42bcaccbbb - 24bcacccb - 70bcbbb - 40bccb -
#> 4bcccabba - 8bcccaccc - 20bcccb - 24bcccbb - 12bccccaaa - 28bccccbbb -
#> 16bcccccb + 3caaaa + 21caaaaaab + 30caaab + 18caaabcac + 12caaabccc + 7cbbba +
#> 49cbbbaaab + 70cbbbb + 42cbbbbcac + 28cbbbbccc + 4ccba + 28ccbaaab + 40ccbb +
#> 24ccbbcac + 16ccbbccc

f(f(y)) # [x, [x, y]]
